update.description:
4 new tutorials:
* installation
* pu/sub
* camera images
* model sdf information

Notes:
  The images won't show up before the PR is merged.
  The gazebojs source code is in the gazebojs  repo.
  I'd like to make sure that setup is robust, so please document any problems / workaround.
update.title: GazeboJs : NodeJs bindings for Gazebo

content.raw: Putting something random like `g.sim.modelFile('a')` breaks Node. Maybe this could be handled better?
content.html: Putting something random like g.sim.modelFile('a') breaks Node. Maybe this could be handled better?

content.raw:
For me it's only doing it once


```
node save_jpeg.js camera frame 10
saving [~/camera/link/camera/image] to  [frame] for 10 frames
setup a loop with 5 sec interval tick
frame_0001.jpeg saved
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
```

For me it's only doing it once

node save_jpeg.js camera frame 10
saving [~/camera/link/camera/image] to  [frame] for 10 frames
setup a loop with 5 sec interval tick
frame_0001.jpeg saved
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick
tick

content.raw: Mine ends with a `Segmentation fault (core dumped)` after this and doesn't reach `process.exit(0);`
content.html: Mine ends with a Segmentation fault (core dumped) after this and doesn't reach process.exit(0);

content.raw: more than one subscriber on the same **topic**?
content.html: more than one subscriber on the same topic?

For me this only works sometimes. I found out if I add a little delay it always works though:

setTimeout(function (){
  gazebo.publish(type, topic , msg);
  console.log('\npublished!');
},10);

content.raw: Publishers allow client and servers to initiate communication, using typed messages. The messages are defined in G**a**zebo using Protobuf, and **they** are accessed in javascript via a JSON representation.
content.html: Publishers allow client and servers to initiate communication, using typed messages. The messages are defined in Gazebo using Protobuf, and they are accessed in javascript via a JSON representation.

content.html: Does it require compiling from source? Maybe it should mention that and then ask to hg up default ? (If it's needed)
